intro: Oberonioides, commonly known as the dwarf orchid, is a member of the Orchidaceae family. It is a small, terrestrial orchid that typically grows in shaded, moist environments. The plant features a slender rhizome and produces delicate, small flowers in shades of white and purple. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, and it is often found in temperate regions. Due to its limited distribution, Oberonioides is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
